name: Anti-Price Gouging Legislation
description:
This law is establishes regulations that prohibit price gouging to ensure a more stable and fair market. This law examines your sale's income and any sales to the University and compares it to your expenses (total), if the ratio of sales / expense is greater than the allowed amount over a period of 5 days, this law imposes a tax recouping from your profits any amount over the threshold permitted. Notifications are sent if you are detected price gouging. You may opt out or mute these notifications by using the command: !PGOpt. You may also toggle all notifications using the commands !OptInAll and !OptOutAll. 

Parliament expressly authorizes the Minister of Infrastructure to manage, modify, and remove districts governed by this law, if applicable.

Needs the following bank accounts for import: Profiteering Assets Holding, Experimental G Data Tracker

properties.Title: (REG) Anti Price Gouging Legislation
properties.UserDescription:
\\Implementation Notes: Authorized builder needs to be subsituted out for the title "In-Review" and "Minimum VI".

This article establishes the criteria and the tax. The stats start recording upon law passage, but the tax starts after Day 4. IMPORTANT NOTE: The tax looks at 5 days worth of data - it's NOT a free pass to overcharge prior to tax enforcement time frame.

The following exemptions exist:
1) Resource gathering professions (farming, gathering, mining, logging, and hunting) by themselves are completely exempt.
2) A grace period applies after taking a new skill subject to this tax for the first time. The grace period is identified below.
3) This tax may apply rather harshly to purely VI businesses and may disproprotionately affect this playstyle. This playstyle may elect to pay an alternate minimum tax if subject to the PG law or be assigned the alternate tax by the PM if the tax is noticed to be excessive.
4) The title "in review" can be used to halt the tax for an individual for need of troubleshooting or resolving court matters.
5) There is an emergency stop button usable by the GMs/PM for troubleshooting or larger problems with this article of the law.

The following values should be adjusted per Parliament:
A) Threshold of the ratio of S_Income/E = 3 (where 1 = breakeven point)
B) Minimum Alternate Tax = 25% of profit if over threshold
C) Memory of when stats are read: 120 hours / 5 days
D) Any additional exemptions to this tax
E) Frequency of tax collection (currently: hourly)
f) The Grace Period Applied (Currently: 72 hours)

properties.Title: PG Notification
properties.UserDescription: This article provides a toggle for the Price Gouging Legislation notifications.

properties.Title: Emergency PG Off Switch
properties.UserDescription: To be used in case of emergencies, press the red button. This article establishes an emergency shut-off for the price gouging legislation to be used if by court order or a significant error/technical issue that necessitates turning off the tax article without an emergency repeal.

properties.Title: Create Grace Period
properties.UserDescription:
This article establishes the grace period when gaining a specialty that is subject to the PG legislation when the citizen was previously not affected by this legislation.

Example: Mining -> Masonry, grace period applies
Masonry -> Advanced Masonry, grace period does not apply

properties.UserDescription:
This article establishes a federal sales income stat for the PG law specifically that uses a different trigger to record the sales income at your store and the federal university.

properties.Title: PG Troubleshooting Data
properties.UserDescription: This article is simply for troubleshooting. For individuals that would be subject to the tax it reports the G value per day in the Experimental G Data Tracker in the personal currency so it can be identified. For individuals not subject to the tax, it will report the G data on their tax card if they wanted the information to help make pricing decisions. Note that the G data refreshes here once per day, but the section that actually charges the tax triggers hourly so this G data may not match that one exactly. The data presented by this article may or may not be accurate and is provided as an estimate only.
